c catheter which causes skin laceration due to stretching.
o Posterior arm delivery may be easier if the woman turns to a knee-elbow position (all-four position)
• an  alternative method is to rotate the baby through 180 degrees to bring the posterior shoulder forward.
o During rotation hold both the arm and the head to facilitate rotation and reduce the risk of injury to the
baby
• if delivery has not been achieved at this point the baby is likely to die.
o If the baby is dead, await spontaneou
